results.title: Scrapbook for 1933
results.brief_description: A film report largely compiled from newsreel material of important people and events of the year 1933. Includes Hitler’s rise to the Chancellorship of Germany; the Reichstag fire; Japan’s war in Jehol and withdrawal from the League of Nations; Hyperion’s Derby; Britain’s first Davis cup since 1912; Jack Crawford’s triumph in the Wimbledon final; extract from Alexander Korda’s “The Private Life of Henry VIII” and the American “42nd Street”. Hit tunes “Shuffle off to Buffalo: and “Lazy Bones”; prohibition repealed in the United States; the evangelists Billy Sunday and Aimee Semple MacPherson; the yo-yo and marathon dancing; appearance of the Loch Ness monster; unemployment and the gathering clouds of a second world war. Voices include Joyce Grenfell, Maurice Denham, James Hayter, Hugh Griffith and Michael Balfour.

results.title: Scramble (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Jimmy has been in trouble with the police. He is befriended by a group who invite him to join the local Motorcycle Scramble Club. Jimmy and his friends become involved with a couple of crooks who attempt to sabotage the club’s chances of winning.

results.title: Scramble
results.creator_credit: Cornwall Modern Boys' School, East Hampshire
results.brief_description: Two young louts grab a model aeroplane from a young school boy. His classmates steal out of classes, surround the offenders and retrieve the plane, returning to class undetected. This is Cornwall’s third award winning film and shows careful and detailed work at the scripting stage; precision, and undisciplined cutting away of the inessential, and imaginative use of the camera.

results.title: Scouts: the rise of the world scouting movement
results.creator_credit: Clear Horizon Films and Michael Dana Murphy
results.brief_description: Scouts is a celebration of the potential of youth that documents the triumphs and tragedies of the Scout ideal. Historic newsreels, rare archival film and scenes from Baden-Powell’s own home movies bring alive the era of Baden-Powell and the origins of Scouting. “Scouts” is a unique program that will captivate any audience, whether or not they have taken the Scout oath.

results.title: Scouting in Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Australian Boy Scouts Association, Joe Scully and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: Illustrates the impact upon a boy of his joining the Scouts, the involvement of his father in the Movement, the Scouts’ work in the community and the international status of the Scouting Movement. Includes scenes of a Scout Rally, an investiture, a Group Committee and the ‘Jamboree of the New Endeavour’ at Leppington, N.S.W

results.title: Scottish universities
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions, Central Office of Information, Scottish Home Department, Donald Alexander and Francis Gysin
results.brief_description: Six hundred years ago, before the first Scottish university was founded, students from Scotland went to Europe to study at Bologna, Paris and Leyden. But for the past five centuries the Scottish universities - St Andrews, Glasgow, Aberdeen, and Edinburgh - have served their own small country, and students from all over the world, with a system of higher education based on that of older European centres. This film tells the story of the foundation and growth of these universities, and describes the difficulties which now confront them because of serious overcrowding. The problems of the students are also presented, particularly lack of funds and lack of suitable living accommodation.

results.title: Scottish country dancing: Mrs MacLeod
results.creator_credit: Thames and Clyde Film Company, JPC Productions and Stanley Russell
results.brief_description: Shows the traditional Scottish dance, the reel. Demonstrates such movements as set two and turn corners and four hands across and back. Concludes with a reel danced to the tune of “Mrs MacLeod”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thames and Clyde Film Company, JPC Productions and Stanley Russell

results.title: Scott Tinley's triathlon training: with Juli Brening
results.brief_description: Veteran Scott Tinley and top triathlete Juli Brening share their training methods and performance tips drawn from years of experience in this most demanding and complex sport. Together they cover swimming, running, cycling, nutrition, weight training and race day strategy.

results.title: Scott of the Antarctic
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Sir Michael Balcon and Charles Frend
results.brief_description: Saga of the ill fated 1912 expedition led by Captain Robert Scott which aimed to be the first to reach the South Pole. Features John Mills, James Robertson Justice and Kenneth Moore.
